reviews.review_msg: REALLY DRY LECTURES. Sometimes i feel like he is just talking to himself rather than teaching. Get ready to read the textbook in your own time because his accent and teaching method just does not work. Midterm worths 45% and final was 50%. Good luck.

Lectures were kind of hit or miss. He seemed really interested in some material he covered and others he seemed bored. There's a midterm, final, and some short quizzes. I was really confused about how much quizzes are worth but they're super easy so go to class to do them! Overall not an amazing prof but he's not bad and he's a really nice guy.
super boring lectures that are not really related to the textbook. Midterm had basically nothing from the lecture

You can't rely on only the textbook because Dr. Liotti's powerpoint slides say very different, sometimes contradictory things. Lectures were very hard to follow. The SA and essay questions on the exams were brutal. The quizzes and multiple choice were fine. His powerpoint slides need a serious makeover - messy to the point where they're unreadable.

My advise: keep up w/ weekly readings & go through lecture slides for exams. You could pass w/o going to class but you will lose 10% for participation marks. A lot of people complain about his accent and that it interfered w/ their understanding but I didn't mind it and actually thought lectures were decent! Overall, I would recommend PSYC 389!

Not a fan. His tests are super hard, mostly because they're poorly written. His lectures are absolutely dry, too scattered & hard to understand. The textbook is way more helpful explaining concepts, sometimes he would confuse me. BUT, he can be funny & his notes attached to lecture slides are helpful studying for quizzes. All in all a GPA downer.

Mario is the cutest little man in the entire world. Just saying. His lectures are unfortunately a little dry, but he does try to spice things up by adding jokes. My advice would be to read the textbook more than anything, and read over lecture notes. This class was easy and FAIR. Know your stuff and you will get an A no problem.

I found the lectures and material to be interesting. He's a really nice prof if you go to office hours and is always willing to explain in further detail. Test material comes straight out of the text book if you read it. You pretty much get what you put in. Material is engaging in itself.

Unfortunately I have to agree with those who posted before me about the quizzes having extremely confusing, often even structurally incorrect wording. If you've already taken 250, 280, or 371 this will be a hard class 4 u as it takes a step back. Things u're tested on don't seem to make much sense. It's great material presented in a very poor way.

Simply Awful. His lectures are dull and unclear. His quizzes/exams are extremely poorly worded and confusing. If you take this class, the textbook will be your best friend, as it is the best thing this class has to offer.

Studied my brains out for this class and the exams/quizzes were just too confusingly worded with double negatives and spelling errors that it didn't even matter how much I actually knew. He reads right off the slides which are pretty much word for word from the textbook. Assignments/tests were confusing and unclear and he was hard to understand.
So hard to understand. Very unorganized and stutters a lot.. made learning the content very hard

Uses the slides that come with the textbook and reads them word for word. He's not interested in the subject and is teaching it due to university request only. Exams are from the test bank, but he rewords the short answer questions, which are very open ended and marked rather harshly. The quizzes come straight from the practice questions online.
Just don't take the class.. tests are extremely difficult and he is so hard to understand. gpa will go down

All around great guy and great prof. You'll do well on the MC if you study the text, and the written questions are from his lectures. Quizzes are ridiculously easy. I would take any course Dr. Liotti teaches!

Really nice. 90% content straight form from the text thats short and easy to read. Multichoice easy. Final cumulative but seriously like 2 questions from first half so w.e. easy. Written harder but still fine if you study hard but we complained and he made them way easier for the final.
Be warned! His multiple choice questions are as easy (class avg 88%), but written questions are as hard/trick as they get (class avg 51%). Be prepaid for very unbalanced exams!
One of the best profs~~!! highly recommended!! Also quite easy as long as you read the text book you will be good for the course.

Seems like a nice guy but unfortunately, he is probably one of the worst profs I've encountered. His accent throws me off big time. He can never finish a sentence explaining concepts without simply reading from the slides that I doubt is even his. He always just gives up trying to explain something in the middle of a sentence and moves on.
Good professor but he can he hard to understand at times. Study his lecture notes/attend class and you'll do fine -- more emphasis on lecture material.

Although English isn't his first language and he sometimes loses his train of thought mid-sentence, he's a good teacher. His interest in the subject is high and he has a lot of fun stuff to share about his research.

He is a great guy.  I think that the people who do poorly in his courses need to read their textbooks better.  His exams are long, but if you study properly it is not really a problem.  He is one of the best biopsychology professors at SFU and I have enormous respect for him, as he is internationally recognized as being a leader in his field.
Nice guy and good to talk to but unorganized. He's helpful, knowledgeable, and can answer almost any question but his mind seems to be elsewhere at times.

He's not a bad, but VERY disorganized and hard to understand at times as English is his second language. His tests were fair, but I don't know about the papers because he never gave us our marks! Not only that, but he forgot about the first class, didn't bring enough exams to the midterm and posted the wrong final marks. He needs to figure it out.

was very hard to understand, and i found his exams VERY long for the time allotted. the essay seemed interesting but almost the whole class got less than B- (which he then scaled) unless you have a strong bio background, i dont recommend this course. Tho he is a nice guy.

It was a special topic course. Mario makes the course very relax that the grad and ugrad students can mingle well together. Though there are a lot of work (many papers to write and read), he is very helpful. Visit him in his lab and he can chat with you for hours going on tangent. You learn a lot and you explore a lot!
